stories.text:
According to the annual M+R Benchmarks Study, just 187 NGOs spent over €100m on online ads last year (https://mrbenchmarks.com/).

I’ve worked at NGOs for many years, and have always felt uneasy about our dependence on Facebook to recruit members online.

What are the ethical alternatives?

Is there, for example, an AdCouncil or nonprofit ad network for mastodon servers and matrix servers and the like?
stories.title: Ask HN: How can nonprofits recruit without Facebook ads?

What might reverse late-night TV’s decline?
If I have two internet connections, how can I use both to increase my bandwidth?

stories.text:
A network diagram of sorts, with the central node is the Backup Router.

Connected to it are all my devices.

I can drill into the Router for various endpoints.

I drag a device/folder between any node or drill-down-folder to drop a sync-link between locations.

Right-click on object for sync details.

Scroll out to select pods, racks, clusters, whatever.

DropBox on DMT.
stories.title: Ask HN: I need a node/graph based backup solution
Ubuntu 22 Is Freezing with Two External Monitors
